data.title: Foster William "Bill" Whiteway
data.text:
NSARM Kings Co. Deaths 1954; Book #1954; Page #2368

Lillian Maude Kendrick, Married, Housewife, 222 Main Street, Wolfville

Born 16 Jun 1915, Hantsport

Died 13 Jan 1954, Main Street, Wolfville, age 38 years, 6 months, 28 days, of Cardiovascular Renal

H/o Alexander Edward Kendrick

D/o Roy Cahoun, Hantsport, and Maude Miles, Hantsport

Informant: Ruth Burgher, Kentville, (no relation)

Buried 15 Jan 1954, Wolfville

Source: Dave Winter, 16 Mar 2008

------------------

Wolfville Acadian, Thursday, January 14, 1954, pg. #4; Reel #4144, NSARM, Halifax, N.S.

OBITUARY: Mrs. A.E. Kendrick

We regret to report the death on Wednesday afternoon of Lillian Maude Kendrick, wife of Alex Kendrick, Wolfville's Chief of Police. Mrs. Kendrick was born in Hantsport 38 years ago, the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Roy Cohoon. Mrs. Kendrick, who was a member of the Wolfville Baptist Church, is survived by her husband and six children, William Whiteway, Gordon Whiteway, Eddie, Ralph, Roy and Joyce; one sister, Hazel (Mrs. Joseph Coffill), Port Williams; two brothers, Wm. Cohoon, of Hantsport and Frank Cohoon, of Fruitland, Ont. Funeral arrangements are incomplete.

------------------

Wolfville Acadian, Thursday, January 21, 1954, pg. #4; Reel #4144, NSARM, Halifax, N.S.

OBITUARY: Mrs. A.E. Kendrick

A funeral service for the late Mrs. Kendrick was held in Lindsay's Funeral Home, Main Street, on Friday afternoon at 3 o'clock. The service was conducted by Rev. H.C. Olsen and during the ceremony a solo: "The Old Rugged Cross" was rendered by Mrs. MacChuskey. Following the service, interment took place in the Willow Bank Cemetery, the committal service also conducted by Rev. Olsen.

Source: Dave Winter, 17 Mar 2008
